abstract: Produces a unique identifier for the source file in which the macro appears.

declaration.code: @freestanding(expression) macro fileID<T>() -> T where T : ExpressibleByStringLiteral

overview:
## Overview

The unique identifier has the form *module*/*file*, where *file* is the name of the file in which the expression appears and *module* is the name of the module that this file is part of.

Because `#fileID` doesn’t embed the full path to the source file, unlike `#filePath`, it gives you better privacy and reduces the size of the compiled binary.

Note: To parse a `#fileID` expression, read the module name as the text before the first slash (`/`) and the filename as the text after the last slash. In future versions of Swift, the string might contain multiple slashes, such as `MyModule/some/disambiguation/MyFile.swift`.

This macro’s value can be changed by `#sourceLocation`, as described in [https://docs.swift.org/swift-book/documentation/the-swift-programming-language/statements#Line-Control-Statement] in [https://docs.swift.org/swift-book/].

# fileID()

**Macro**

Produces a unique identifier for the source file in which the macro appears.

## Declaration

```swift
@freestanding(expression) macro fileID<T>() -> T where T : ExpressibleByStringLiteral
```

## Overview

The unique identifier has the form *module*/*file*, where *file* is the name of the file in which the expression appears and *module* is the name of the module that this file is part of.

Because `#fileID` doesn’t embed the full path to the source file, unlike `#filePath`, it gives you better privacy and reduces the size of the compiled binary.

Note: To parse a `#fileID` expression, read the module name as the text before the first slash (`/`) and the filename as the text after the last slash. In future versions of Swift, the string might contain multiple slashes, such as `MyModule/some/disambiguation/MyFile.swift`.

This macro’s value can be changed by `#sourceLocation`, as described in [https://docs.swift.org/swift-book/documentation/the-swift-programming-language/statements#Line-Control-Statement] in [https://docs.swift.org/swift-book/].

## Getting Source Location Information

- **file()**: Produces the path to the file in which it appears.
- **filePath()**: Produces the complete path to the file in which the macro appears.
- **function()**: Produces the name of the declaration in which it appears.
- **line()**: Produces the line number on which it appears.
- **column()**: Produces the column number in which the macro begins.

items.description: Produces the path to the file in which it appears.
